_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Fresh Express Streamwood has developed a Risk Management Program in

compliance with the Environmental Protection Agency's final Rule 40 CFR Part

68. The regulated substance is anhydrous ammonia with a total inventory charge

over the threshold quantity of 10,000 lbs. Since the facility is also subject to the

Occupational Safety and Health Administration's PSM Standard 29 CFR

1910.119, Program 3 is required.



1.2       ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE

POLICIES



The Fresh Express, Streamwood facility has an emergency response plan in

effect. The emergency response plan is detailed in the Emergency Planning and

Response section of this PSM/RMP document. This plan was designed to meet

the following objectives:



1. To save lives.

2. To minimize and avoid injuries.

3. To protect the environment.

4. To minimize property damage.



Fresh Express, Streamwood maintains a Process Safety Management committee

which contains members who are the emergency coordinators for the facility. The

emergency action plan provides the response organization and notification

procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation

procedures for which will be implemented to take action effectively to emergency

situations that may arise at the facility. This plan is reviewed and updated at least

once per year. This plan was updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and

RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate facility changes.



1.3       STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The ammonia process was designed and constructed in accordance with all

applicable federal, state and local regulations. The facility is located at 1109 E.

Lake Street, Streamwood, IL.

The ammonia refrigeration system uses ammonia for the storage of various food

products. The majority of the system is located in the engine room including

vessels and compressors. The condenser is mounted on the engine room roof, and

all air units an

d process chillers are located in their respective cold storage and

process areas.





1.4       ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICALSPECIFIC

PREVENTION STEPS



The facility that Fresh Express, Streamwood occupies is new as of February,

2013. The ammonia refrigeration system installed was designed and constructed

in accordance with ammonia refrigeration industry safety and design standards. In

addition, the majority of the ammonia is maintained inside the engine room or on

the engine room roof. The engine room is provided with continuous ventilation

and all equipment is monitored for temperature and pressure 24 hours a day.

The facility is secured and guarded at all times.

In addition to the International Mechanical Code, the facility will operate in

accordance with the

International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines. In particular,

the IIAR Bulletin 110, "Start-up, Inspection, and Maintenance of Ammonia

Refrigeration Systems."



1.5     ACCIDENT HISTORY - LAST FIVE YEARS



An ammonia release was reported on 06/05/2017. The cause was an evaporator

that was struck by a forklift. There is a record of the ammonia release incident on

file as part of the facility Process Safety Management Program.



1.6     EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Fresh Express is included in the written community emergency response plan.

The facility has its own emergency action plan. The emergency action plan

includes procedures for informing the public and local response agencies of a

chemical release. The emergency action plan also includes information on

emergency health care.

Fresh Express does not respond to emergencies. Fresh Express coordinates its

Emergency Action Plan with the Streamwood Fire Department.

In the event that an ammonia leak is discovered, the person nearest the leak will

notify a supervisor, maintenance or risk management. Under certain

circumstances an alarm will sound and automatically notify the 24-hour security

co

mpany who in turn will page the Facility Manager. In either event a team of at

least two trained individuals will respond to the scene to assess the situation.

Portable radios and an ammonia sampling meter are used for communication and

air sampling. The emergency coordinators will be notified of the situation and

will determine what procedures and personnel, including contractors, are

necessary to remedy the problem. Emergency agencies will also be notified as

necessary as outlined in the Emergency Response Plan.





1.7     PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY





Fresh Express has performed a Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) and Compliance

Audit per their Process Safety Management and Risk Management programs.

Areas for improvement during the PHA and Compliance Audit were identified

and corrective actions recommended. All recommendations are promptly

addressed.
